text: == Events == * November 25 — Baldwin IV of Jerusalem and Raynald of Chatillon beat Saladin at the Battle of Montgisard. * During the third year of the Angen era in Japan, a fire devastates Kyoto. * Benedictus Abbas becomes abbot of Peterborough. * Byland Abbey is started in Yorkshire by the Cistercians. * Casimir II becomes duke of Poland. * The Cham sack the Khmer capital of Angkor Wat. * Roger de Moulins becomes Grand Master of the Knights Hospitaller. * Moscow is burned down. * Puigcerdà is founded by Alfonso II of Aragon. * Leopold V becomes Duke of Austria. * September 27 — Pope Alexander III sends a letter to Prester John, believing he is real. * Treaty of Venice — Frederick I Barbarossa accepts Alexander III as Pope * Estonians attack Pskov during winter. == Births == * Baldwin V, king of Jerusalem (d. 1186) * Robert de Ros, English baron (d. 1226) * Philip of Swabia, enemy of Otto IV, Holy Roman Emperor (d. 1208) == Deaths == * January 13 — Henry II of Austria (b. 1107) * William of Montferrat, Count of Jaffa and Ascalon, father of Baldwin V of Jerusalem (b. early 1140s) * Hugh Bigod, 1st Earl of Norfolk (b. 1095) == Heads of State == * England — Henry II (reigned 1154–1189) * France — Louis VII (reigned 1137–1180) * Byzantine Empire — Manuel I Comnenus (reigned 1143–1180) * Pope — Alexander III (pope 1159–1181) * Song China – Song Xiaozong (宋孝宗) (reigned 1162–1189)
